elements.summary:
Marc is a key figure in the fight against climate change and shaping the global sustainable
development agenda. For more than two decades, he has been actively involved in various
expert groups at the highest international level. He is the author of the UN-SDG Manifesto
and a close collaborator of the UNFCCC, dedicated to the development of systemic
regenerative solutions. As a member of the EU ESG Taxonomy PSF Commission, he
influences environmental policies worldwide, advocating future-fit models of society and
governance. He is Board member of the Dubai Future Foundation, Chair of the UNFCCC
Innovation Hub, and active contributor to the World Economic Forum’s expert groups, and is
the author of books such as " Leadership for Sustainable Futures".
As a global authority in the field of sustainable development, he advises companies, leads
workshops and gives talks at events around the world in preparation for the UN Summit of
the Future 2024 and COP29. He takes a systemic approach to life and deals with all aspects
of complex systems, actively contributing to the reduction of human suffering through
sustainable solutions."
elements.label: Prof. Dr. Marc Buckley LL.M.

elements.summary:
Aaron Berger is a research scientist specializing in global catastrophic risks, geopolitical spillover events, and complexity. Working at the delta of deep tech, government relations, and impact, he has spent his time contributing strategic and critical thinking to organizations on multiple global issues, with a particular focus on climate change. A diverse background in international relations has engendered a broad understanding of how to reach individuals across different parts of the political spectrum. He serves as a strategic advisor to individuals and organizations interested in finding important solutions to difficult problems. In his effort to help others see a more systemic perspective, his research methods break down problems into their foundational elements, analysis of which yields new angles and novel solutions.

In addition to being an Advisor to NEXUS, he’s Co-founder and Director of Policy and Government Relations for VMind AI, Special Advisor on Innovation and Technology to The Rainey Center for Public Policy, and UN Representative for NEU Global.

elements.summary: Alex Corren specializes in bioregionalism, land tenure, and regenerative community development. He holds a B.Sc. in Environmental Science with a focus on ecological design and water resources, complemented by over a decade of experience in related fields. As the CEO and Co-Founder of ReCommon, Alex develops systems and tools to advance regenerative community development and bioregional impact initiatives globally. His expertise includes landscape assessment, commons governance, natural building, ecovillage design, and ecological economics. Currently, he focuses on impact mapping tools for bioregional initiatives. Outside work, Alex enjoys living a healthy lifestyle in Rollinsville, Colorado.

Daniela Fernandez is a visionary nonprofit leader and social entrepreneur who has made it her life’s mission to restore the health of the ocean and empower young leaders as they create a sustainable future. She founded Sustainable Ocean Alliance in her Georgetown University dorm room when she was only 19 years old. Since 2014, Daniela has helped create the world’s largest network of young ocean leaders, establishing a presence in 186 countries and accelerating 420 solutions to heal, protect, and restore our ocean. 

Daniela has been recognized for her work by former U.S. Secretary John Kerry, U.S. President Bill Clinton, and E.U. Commissioner Karmenu Vella. She was awarded the 2020 Rising Star Visionary Award by the Silicon Valley Forum, named a 2019 Forbes 30 under 30 social entrepreneur, and is a LinkedIn Top Voices in Social Impact creator.

elements.summary:
Matthew is the founder of A1 AI, shifting centres of gravity

Matthew has advised the leadership of financial institutions, FTSE 100 companies, investors and policy makers around the globe on shifting their centres of gravity towards Generative AI, web3 and frontier tech as central catalysts for sustainable growth, in deals valued in excess of $2bn.

Inclusion and strategies for climate transition sit at the core of Matthew’s practice. He advises a global green finance fund and has co-led the development of a climate justice working model with the leadership of a major European city and the EU.

A former Big4 banking and capital markets consultant, Matthew is an Expert Outlook thought leader at Canvas8.com and has been recognised as a 'visionary' public speaker at venues including Google, Meta, DLA Piper, The Turing Trust, Institutional Investor, Next Money, Money 2020 TedX Roma, The Web Foundation, The Global Leaders Forum and Finnovasia.

Matthew has delivered guest lectures at LBS, Bayes, The Asian Banking School and The Royal College of Art. He has co-founded an initiative for refugee aid in Europe and sits on the board of The Busking Project, a not for profit supporting street performers and musicians.

elements.summary:
Brian Robertson is best known for creating Holacracy, the most widespread framework in the world today for running self-managed companies using a decentralized power structure in lieu of a traditional management hierarchy.

He founded the consultancy HolacracyOne to help organizations unleash creativity and empower the leadership of their people. He also founded the software company GlassFrog, which helps both traditional and self-managed companies drive organizational transparency, agility, and alignment to purpose. Brian’s passion for harnessing sovereignty and human potential in organizations is backed by a deep spirituality and wide-open heart, which he regularly shares in talks and interviews that seamlessly weave between business, management, consciousness, and love.

To date, tens of thousands of companies in over 50 countries have embraced his pioneering methods and ideas. Brian is the author of the book Holacracy: The New Management System for a Rapidly Changing World.

elements.summary:
Within an emerging field of inner-led societal transformation, Jamie Bristow works to accelerate and deepen the integration of inner and outer systems change approaches. Jamie's most recent publication, 'The System Within: addressing the inner dimensions of sustainability and systems transformation', was commissioned by Club of Rome Co-President Sandrine Dixon-Decleve as a complement to 'Earth for All: A survival guide for humanity', a report to the Club of Rome. It provides a short ‘101’ of the inner, psycho-social-spiritual dimension that is too often overlooked in considering global crisis and pathways for change.

The primary question animating Jamie's research, writing and speaking relates to practice - what are we practising, individually and collectively, to be more equal to the challenges of our times? Jamie has collaborated on this question with UN and US Government Agencies, cross-party groups of politicians in the British Parliament and legislatures around the world, global corporates, leading NGOs and pioneering academic departments. Jamie’s work has been covered in The Times, The Financial Times and The Guardian newspapers. He has taught and advised on courses at the Universities of California, Harvard and Oxford. Jamie is currently a research fellow and member of Life Itself, an honorary associate of Bangor University and a fellow of Mind & Life, and he leads on public narrative and policy development for the Inner Development Goals, emphasising the inner skills and qualities needed for a sustainable transition. Formerly he was Director of The Mindfulness Initiative policy institute and Business Development Director at Headspace, and his background encompasses psychology, climate change campaigning, and advertising.

elements.summary:
What I Do: Child Empowerment Guide
I am a Child Empowerment Guide, and my mission is to guide and inspire children to reach their highest potential in all aspects of life. My work is all about elevating the vibrations of our world for the greater good.
Role and Approach:
I believe that we all have the power to choose who we become, and I am here to help children make those choices wisely. I see myself as a silent guide, working subtly through various modern mediums like YouTube, social media, toys, and games.
My Approach:
* Empowerment: I empower children to become the heroes of their own futures. I do this by instilling in them a deep sense of self-belief and the understanding that their choices shape their destinies.
* Education: Education is my tool, and I use it to teach children the importance of gratitude over attitude. I want them to be aware of their infinite power to create positive change.
* Creating a Brighter Future: I firmly believe that every child has the potential to switch on their inner light, one by one, and together, they can create a brighter future for all life on Earth.
Tools of the Trade:
* YouTube & Social Media: I harness the power of these platforms to deliver meaningful content that resonates with young minds.
* Toys & Games: Play is a profound teacher. I use toys and games as vehicles for valuable life lessons.
Why I Do It:
I am driven by a deep passion for guiding and empowering children. I believe that by shaping their values and choices, we can collectively shift the energy of our world towards a more positive and harmonious state.
I am on a mission to inspire, to guide, and to change the frequency, one child at a time.

elements.summary:
Life blessed me with supportive parents, a study in business economics and a starting career in the financial world. I quickly realized economics wasn’t my field however and I went back to study medicine.
This change of direction resulted in a wider shift of perspective. I discovered my passion to encounter different cultures and started a journey to my personal karmic past. I learned new healing techniques and studied the treasures of our ancestors in India, Tibet, the Andes, the Amazon and the savannah of Africa. I wanted to find a way to integrate the healing techniques from all these different sources. 
I did dream of the perfect family. After getting beautiful children out of my marriage I however realized soon that I had to make a choice for a life in Vienna or a life following my passions abroad. From there a new life with my two children started.  
My big love was healing work. Healing on different levels. My passion for the plant world and energy work took shape. Who would have thought that it would bring me to Africa? 
For the last 12 years I have been living in Tanzania. Between people from the Maasai and Meru tribes. Learning from them but also bringing medical and educational support to woman and children in need. Through the running of our NGO, Africa Amini Alama, and while working as a natural healer, shamanic practitioner and medical doctor I face challenges, but also experience much joy in my life.

elements.summary:
Murtala has garnered extensive experience over two decades as a management, development, and 
governance consultant, collaborating with a range of international and nonprofit organizations, 
including FHI360, Westminster Foundation for Democracy, United Nations, GPE/World Bank, and 
DFID/FCDO. With certifications from the Nigerian Center for Management Development and 
accolades such as being named a Goalkeeper of the Sustainable Development Goals by the Bill and 
Melinda Gates Foundation, Murtala has excelled in driving key initiatives across governance, 
democracy, climate change, and education sectors. His work primarily involves strategic 
coordination and crafting policies that significantly enhance the effectiveness of government 
systems, particularly in the development of performance management systems (PMS) for high-level 
government officials.
In his role, Murtala has led numerous strategic initiatives that focus on strengthening performance 
management systems and building the capacity of high-ranking government officials across various 
sectors in Nigeria. Notable among his contributions is his role as the Lead Consultant for the 
Partnership for Learning for All in Nigeria (PLANE) initiative, where he reviewed and developed 
strategic action plans for the Nigeria Federal Ministry of Education. He also designed and facilitated 
workshops aimed at implementing new performance management policies for the Nigeria Civil 
Aviation Authority’s management team, enhancing their operational efficiency. Moreover, his work 
with the National Agency for the Control of AIDS (NACA) involved developing robust Monitoring and 
Evaluation frameworks during their retreats, focusing on performance management.
Murtala’s academic background enriches his professional expertise in PMS training. He holds a Ph.D. 
in Rural Geography from the University of Port Harcourt, focusing on climate change impacts on rural 
livelihoods, and Master’s degrees in Development Studies and Ecology from Bayero University Kano 
and the University of Aberdeen, respectively. These degrees have equipped him with a profound 
understanding of educational and environmental governance, enabling him to design and implement 
effective training programs in performance management systems for top government officials.
elements.label: MURTALA MOHAMMED

elements.summary:
Kevin Richards, MBA, IoD
Kevin Richards is a recognized thought leader in climate finance, the blue economy, and digital innovation. As Managing Director of Bermuda Asset Management, he advises family offices and investment funds on sustainable transitions. He also founded Bermuda Global Holdings, driving blue bond issuance and the Island SDG Impact Fund, supporting early-stage disruptive technologies aligned with Bermuda's economic diversification.
A certified Director and member of the UK’s Institute of Directors, Kevin is actively shaping Bermuda’s innovation ecosystem. He serves on multiple boards, including the Bermuda Institute of Ocean Science and Zero Hash Worldwide. With a background at Chubb and GE, Kevin returned to Bermuda in 2015 to foster growth in international commerce and technology. A former professional athlete, he represented Bermuda in two World Cup football campaigns.

elements.summary:
Dr. Mark Guishard is the Chief Operating Officer of ASU Bermuda Institute of Ocean Sciences (BIOS). BIOS is a world-renowned independent marine science and education organization, delivering cutting-edge research in oceanography, climate change, and marine science, fostering understanding and solutions for the challenges facing our oceans. BIOS is part of The Global Futures Laboratory at Arizona State University, dedicated to addressing the complex challenges of sustainability and the future of our planet. By integrating research, education, and public engagement, the laboratory seeks to develop solutions that ensure a thriving future for all.

Mark has a PhD in Meteorology from Penn State University, and a Master’s in Atmospheric Sciences from the University of East Anglia. He is a Fellow of the Royal Meteorological Society and a member of the Institute of Directors. He serves on Bermuda’s Climate Change Task Force and has recently been a Focal Point for Disaster Risk Reduction for the Caribbean, North and Central America under the UN World Meteorological Organization. Mark, a Bermudian, is a Chartered Meteorologist with over 25 years of experience, including management of the Risk Prediction Initiative at BIOS, connecting a network of climate and catastrophe risk scientists with the re/insurance and risk transfer industry. He has been the Director of the Bermuda Weather Service and Chief Administrative Officer at the Bermuda Airport Authority. Mark’s current research and education interests include Atlantic hurricanes, small island risk & resilience, and local weather & climate. In addition to academic publications and conference presentations on these subjects, he has recently issued public reports and hosted town hall meetings on Bermuda’s impacts from climate change.
elements.SDGs: 14. Life Below Water | 13. Climate Action
elements.label: Mark Guishard

elements.summary:
Our talk will discuss the Organic Pod Farmhouse System:

The Organic Pod Farmhouxxse System (OPFS) is a 10-story building with 400
Organic Pods, that sits on an acre of land. The Organic Pod Farm System is
powered by solar and if solar is unavailable, the energy need is minimal. The
OPF uses the F.R.O.M.A.E.N. G is a technique to grow food.
F.R.O.M.A.E.N.G is an acronym that stands for, Farming Regenerative Organic
Meals Automatically Easily Guaranteed. Each Organic Pod uses this process.
The Organic Pod is a structure which combines aquaponics, poultry farming,
vermiculture, traditional plant agriculture, proprietary filtering technology and
cultivation of aquatic weeds. After a year of the ecosystem being established,
the entire system becomes regenerative and is powered by solar.
Annually, each Organic Pod produces 300-500 fish, 1-17,500 eggs and almost
unlimited fruits and vegetables. Part of the system has a 10-story Organic Pod
Farmhouse. There are five floors for meat birds, two floors for aquaponic
produce, a floor for egg layers, a floor for a pond and a floor for a processing
center.

Using only an acre to produce enough food to feed 6,000 people while
positively impacting the environment and community. The food and bodily
waste are all recycled on the property to eliminate injuring the local food and
water supply. This is the future of organic farming and food production.
Impact Sectors: Regenerative Agriculture, Bioregionalism, Food Systems, and Soil
elements.label: Ending World Hunger in 10 years...On One Acre

elements.summary: Psychedelic experiences offer a profound reconnection to the natural world, evoking a sense of oneness with all things and beings. They bring forth a revitalized vision of what is possible, empowering individuals and communities to envision and enact transformative climate action. Join us to explore how one community is raising and expanding consciousness, discovering pathways forward, and integrating, embodying, and transforming your Climate Week insights into meaningful action.
Impact Sectors: Health, Mental Health, and Social Connection
elements.label: How Psychedelics Can Inspire Climate Action, this Week and Beyond

elements.summary:
Personal Story: I'll begin with a story about a highly successful man who, when he first came to me, didn’t understand what love felt like. By the end of our retreat and sessions, he experienced embodied love, which transformed his personal life, family dynamics, and the culture of his multi-billion dollar company. He started unregulated and dissociated but left feeling… well, whole.

Visualization Exercise: We’ll engage in a visualization exercise to reflect on our own moments of feeling unregulated and disconnected from our hearts. We’ll explore how these states affect our reactions versus responses, and then scale this to the impact on world leaders. As Elon Musk mentioned, “When I’m depressed I make worse decisions.” 

Vision of Conscious Leadership: We’ll envision a world of conscious leaders and define what it means to lead with compassion, a connected heart, and a regulated nervous system. We’ll discuss the positive impact such leadership can have.

My Approach: I’ll explain how I help individuals and organizations achieve this state through somatic psychotherapy and psychedelic medicine.

Call to Action: (my proposal, but open to changing this) I’ll invite listeners to join a new initiative, co-created with Elliott, focusing on psychedelic retreats that encompass the following two-fold purpose:
1. Expanding states of consciousness to reconnect leaders with the truest parts of  themselves.
2. From THAT place, ideating on solving the worlds most pressing issues.
Impact Sectors: Health, Mental Health, and Social Connection

elements.summary:
Within an emerging field of inner-led societal transformation, Jamie Bristow works to accelerate and deepen the integration of inner and outer systems change approaches. Jamie's most recent publication, 'The System Within: addressing the inner dimensions of sustainability and systems transformation', was commissioned by Club of Rome Co-President Sandrine Dixon-Decleve as a complement to 'Earth for All: A survival guide for humanity', a report to the Club of Rome. It provides a short ‘101’ of the inner, psycho-social-spiritual dimension that is too often overlooked in considering global crisis and pathways for change.

The primary question animating Jamie's research, writing and speaking relates to practice - what are we practising, individually and collectively, to be more equal to the challenges of our times? Jamie has collaborated on this question with UN and US Government Agencies, cross-party groups of politicians in the British Parliament and legislatures around the world, global corporates, leading NGOs and pioneering academic departments. Jamie’s work has been covered in The Times, The Financial Times and The Guardian newspapers. He has taught and advised on courses at the Universities of California, Harvard and Oxford. Jamie is currently a research fellow and member of Life Itself, an honorary associate of Bangor University and a fellow of Mind & Life, and he leads on public narrative and policy development for the Inner Development Goals, emphasising the inner skills and qualities needed for a sustainable transition. Formerly he was Director of The Mindfulness Initiative policy institute and Business Development Director at Headspace, and his background encompasses psychology, climate change campaigning, and advertising.

elements.description:
Molly Burhans is an internationally recognized environmentalist, cartographer, and social entrepreneur. Molly has been publishing professional design media since 2004 and holds an M.S. from the Conway School. She is the founder of GoodLands, an organization whose mission is to mobilize large landholders to use their property for environmental and humanitarian good. Molly oversaw the creation of first unified data-based global map of the Catholic Church’s governing (ecclesiastical) jurisdictions at ESRI as an invited researcher. These maps premièred at the Vatican in 2016.

Molly is a United Nations’ Young Champion of the Earth, representing North America in 2019. She is a Sierra Club EarthCare laureate, one of Encyclopedia Britannica‘s 2022 20 Under 40 in the category of Academia and Ideas, a National Geographic Emerging Explorer (2021), Ashoka Fellow (2018), Henry Arnhold Conservation Fellow (2020), and Grist Fixer (2020).

Molly has developed models and projects related to ecological restoration across geographic scales, global meta-state governance, conservation financing with non-taxable landholders, and data infrastructure deployment for global non-state actors. This work has gained interest and recognition from academic, governmental, and private sector organizations.

Molly’s work has been covered by major media outlets including The New Yorker, BBC, Forbes, and The Boston Globe. She is a leading voice and activist in the Faith for Earth space. She has been an invited speaker at universities, academic and technology conferences, the United Nations, and the Pontifical Academy of Sciences
elements.label: Molly Burhans

elements.summary:
I believe every child and young person – some 3.5 billion by 2030 – represent the biggest force for positive change in human history. But our outdated and limited educational systems leave the vast majority powerless and dependent despite trillions of dollars invested every year. The cost of inaction is even higher. 

That's why is started few years ago Sikana, a Social Business with a mission to empower young people to be resilient, develop their full potential and serve the common good by developing a better educational system powered by world-class technological, collaborative and educational solutions accessible online and offline, affordable to the many.

So far, Sikana has mobilized 100 renowned NGOs, a dozen leader brands, governments, institutions and thousands of contributors around the project. Sikana has designed, produced, dubbed and distributed thousands of high quality educational videos. Sikana has 4 millions subscribers and 2 billions lessons has been delivered so far around the world. 

Currently, Sikana is working on a platform to collaboratively co-own, design, produce and distribute the best educational programs in the world on our platform and ecosystem using advanced technology, collaborative intelligence, new approach. marginal cost and maximum impact. affordable and accessible.
